problem.description: Consider the following flow network with source node s, sink node t, and in which the capacities are indicated in each edge. A cut partitions the vertices into two disjoint sets, S and T, where S contains all the vertices on the source side of the cut, and T contains all the vertices on the sink side of the cut. Consider the minimum cut of the above flow network and select the option that corresponds to the set S in that cut.

question.task: Find the minimum cut and identify the set S (source side vertices)

cut_definition.S: All vertices on the source side of the cut
cut_definition.T: All vertices on the sink side of the cut
cut_definition.constraint: S and T are disjoint sets
cut_definition.objective: Minimize the sum of capacities of edges crossing from S to T

steps: Calculate maximum flow from s to t using Ford-Fulkerson or similar algorithm
By max-flow min-cut theorem, the value of max flow equals the capacity of min cut
Identify the minimum cut by finding edges that are saturated in the max flow
The set S consists of all vertices reachable from s using edges with remaining capacity in the residual graph
